Loisir Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8 Very good
Based on 1994 reviews

The location of the hotel is really great. The room was clean and spacious enough for a solo traveller.

I cannot find a shaver and shaving gel, so I had to go out to buy one. I could not find any information in advance that the room does not have those. In addition to this, I wasn't sure if I booked a non-smoking room and sent a message to double check, but I didn't get any reply. Furthermore, the attitude of the Front Office staff was sort of disappointing. I arrived earlier than 15:00 and went up to the Front Desk to see if I could check-in. The guy there was very businesslike and just told me "Check-in is 15:00, come back later". If a hotel is like 3 or 4 star hotel, at least they try to see if there's a room which is ready even before the check-in time. Hotels I have stayed before did that. Hence, I got the impression that it was my fault that I got there early, stupid that I asked for check-in. I'm glad I stayed there only for one night.

Show more
Takashi , Japan
Nine Tree Premier Hotel Myeong dong 2
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1233 reviews

Stayed for 5d4n in their 'Standard Double' room (Room no. 1107). Agoda stated that it is with KING size bed.

However the bed provided is only in QUEEN size, thus abit dissapointed. We arrived early at about 11.30am and granted an early checked in, this is really nice treat as we all are really tired after a 6 hours flight. Sadly i didn't manage to get the N Seoul Tower view room, our room is facing the front side, no spectacle view from our room. However the cleanliness of the room is top notch. As this is a very new hotel, everything is new and modern. Room is equipped with L-shape sofa, writing table, safebox, small fridge, hair dryrer, usb port socket, bathrope, bathtub and commplete set of toiletries. Hotel is very close to Euljiro 3(sam)-ga subway station (green and orange line), about 5 mins walk. The airport limousine bus (no.6015) also stop at Euljiro 3(sam)-ga bus stop. Walking distance about 800 meters to popular Myeongdong street. We even walking back from N Seoul Tower to the hotel, the distance is about 2.5 km and since it is going downhill from N Seoul Tower, the walk is very easy. Hotel has a gym and lounge at level 18 which we can enjoy the free flow of coffee all day long. Each floor itself also has a 'refresh room' fitted with water dispenser machine, ice cube machine, microwave oven and ironing tools. This is very good as we can save the money on buying the drinking water or mineral water. However at the hotel lobby, there is a 24 hours convenient store (G25) where we bought our T-Money card. There is also a laundry services located at the basement.The staff is very friendly, make sure you get the tourist map from the hotel concierge as the map really help, the map show very details of each subway station exits. Bare in mind it is very confusing with so much exits in a subway station. With the map guidance, we easily head to our exit without much hassle. Overall i will say this is a very good hotel.

Show more
leong , Malaysia
Lotte Hotel Seoul
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2041 reviews

All in all was good but Room quite small since 3 pax (add on trundle bed) sharing one room. Thought more spacious room will be granted.

Not enough space to open 3 luggage at one time! I must separately compliment the staff there. Always greeted us in sunshine smile. Very friendly and helpful. Location was close to subway, easy access to Lotte departmental store (too bad their operating hour wasn't fantastic). There's actually underground link to city hall station. Approx 8 mins walk to myeongdong street. In house facilities was awesome. Swimming cap, towels, water, hairdryer, lotion, hair serum, moisturizer and even gym wear (exclude sport shoes) was provided.

Show more
EE , Singapore
Dormy Inn Premium Seoul Garosugil
8.9 Excellent
Based on 623 reviews

I enjoyed my stay. The staff was professional and helpful for the most part. I had some difficulty being understood over the phone, but that's okay because English isn't their first language.

When I had questions about airport buses, the staff was very kind and patient with my questions and helped me resolve my issue. I enjoyed the onsen and the food there is fabulous. The staff in the dining area were always polite and welcoming. It's a busy hotel in a trendy area of Seoul, so I really appreciated how quiet the floors were. I didn't hear any traffic or even my neighbors. The decor is soothing and I especially loved the changing pictures in front of the elevators on the different floors. I will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time that I visit Seoul.

Show more
Elizabeth , United States
Tmark Grand Hotel Myeongdong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 970 reviews

I made the mistake of boarding an airport bus going to "Tmark Hotel", which is different and over 2 km away from this one "Tmark Grand Hotel".

Do pay attention when arriving at the airport. I honestly wish hotel owners wouldn't use such naming conventions with high risk of tripping people up. For its price, almost everything I expected from this place was provided. However, (1) wifi was slow in the evenings, (2) sachets of tea provided but no sachets of sugar or creamer, (3) BBC World news channel did not work. All other fixtures were in good working order. However, there are other hotels with similarly good facilities and therefore this one isn't exactly great value for money. Tmark Grand's location was excellent, being almost on top of Hoehyeon metro station. Do note however that although it says it is one station away from the main railway station and from the map it looks like a walkable distance, in reality because of road construction and detours, and poor provision of lifts and escalators -- you'd have to haul your luggage up and down stairs while trying to navigate a confusing maze of tunnels -- it's a bit of a nightmare.

Show more
Wai , Singapore
Days Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1209 reviews

Once you exit from myeongdong station exit 5, walk straight and you will see another hotel first then gongcha.

Issac toast is located just beside Days hotel. Some of the rooms are smaller. My sis and I were lucky that our room was bigger than my friend's room that's just next to us. Their room was so small that they have difficulty in opening their luggages. The airport bus was about 5 to 10 mins away from the hotel which do not require you to carry the heavy luggages now to the metro station. It cost about 15,000 won per pax. We were told that the hotel can help us to call for jumbo taxi. The taxi fare will be 70,000 won. We (4 person) have too many baggages and thought it would be good to save us some walking distance by paying abit more. To our horror, the taxi driver charged us 95,000 won instead of the fare told by the hotel. We are unsure if we got scammed or the information provided by the hotel was incorrect.

Show more
wan , Singapore
Nine Tree Hotel Myeong-dong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4572 reviews

The location is wonderful as it is right in the middle of Myeongdong. So convenient for dining and shopping purposes.

The airport bus was really just 20m away from the hotel, so there is no need for us to take any cab during our 7 days trip. Saved a lot of this. The subway was also 20m away from any other attractions we wanted to visit. However, the hotel can do better for travellers who are staying longer. The family twin we had was way too small for 3 standard luggage. The elevator was full after the 3 of us + our luggage got in. The hotel lobby is located at L3, while L1 is just a small sitting area for people who want to get some rest for more shopping. The room has no standard toiletries provided and you will need to request from the receptionist if you need any cotton wool, toothbrush or shaver. The room has standard soap, shampoo and conditioner dispenser. One thing, which was uncalled for was the toilet bowl facility, there is a note for user NOT to throw any toilet paper into the toilet bowl to prevent blockage of the toilet system. *Faints*. We saw a big patch of reddish/yellowish sticky stain on the edge of the bath tub when we checked in, after 2 days (though everyday we had our room being made by the housekeeping) the stain was still there. Finally, to give the benefit of doubts that the patch was permanent, we used a tissue paper to clean it, to our surprise it came out easily! The carpet is awfully dirty and sticky, so please wear the slipper provided, all the time. Even though the slippers provided were reused as well but better than nothing. Bottled drinks are not replenish daily and you will need to wait for 3 to 4 days for the next replenishment but that wasn't a problem at all as there is a hot/cold water dispenser at each level. It is very convenient for those who drink a lot and too lazy to boil water for their hot beverages. There is no wardrobe per se, just a hanging area for few clothing right behind the entrance. It is not a problem

Show more
tina , Singapore
Hotel PJ Myeongdong
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7424 reviews

Friendly staffs, nice location near chungmuro station. I booked for quad room which include 4 single beds.

very spacious. Hotel provide 2 shuttle bus service. One to myeongdong and lotte department store and one to dongdaemum market. Suggest you take the shuttle bus, sit one round and familar with the surrounding. Very near myeongdong shopping area. 2 stations one station away from chungmuro station. If take taxi from myeongdong back to the hotel, is only cost around 5000 won.There are alot of eating places opposite the chungmuro station. From the hotel main entrance, just walk all the way straight and you can find the chungmuro station and restaurants. Hotel breakfast is not fanstatic as the spread if food is very limited and is cost 15000 won, special rate for guest who room does not inlcude breakfast. I would suggest to take the shuttle bus to myeongdong area for breakfast instead. Overall the staying experience is very good. I will sure stay in this hotel again.

Show more
YIN , Singapore
Royal Hotel Seoul
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1509 reviews

Upon check in, front office agent asked if we would like a big bed instead of the twin bed (which we requested).

I declined as I purposely requested for a twin bed. The front office agent tried asking again and I asked if the big bed has a bigger room. He said no and I then told him I would like to stick to my request. I also requested for a high floor ( the hotel has 20 levels of rooms), we were given the 7th floor ( not particularly high enough). When we got into our room, we opened the window curtain and saw a view of concrete building. Not happy at all. I discovered a used face towel under the sink and a strand of hair was on the bath tub from the previous occupant. And also found, a rice cracker by the side of the bed. Obviously, cleaning has been rushed and the attention to details was not there. When our room was being cleane the next day, no replenishment of amenities of toiletries. Very disappointing. Last day, the toilet bowl could not flush which was inconvenient for us.

Show more
Han , Singapore
Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3413 reviews

SkyPark is easily accessible from icn, it's just a 5mins walk from bus6015-royal hotel stop. It's located in myeongdong area where food & shopping are at your doorsteps, yet quiet enough for a good rest.

The staff greets me every time I step into the hotel & are helpful with all my enquiries on directions. Namdaemun market is a 15 -20mins walk away from the hotel , while myeongdong station is 5-10 mins away. There is also free shuttle bus service between Seoul station to the hotel. This service is good for people traveling to Seoul via the AREX and make visits to Lotte Mart easy. I liked the free water dispenser ( serving both Hot & cold water ) on every floor. However , I was unable to do an early check in . But this is fine for me, as I was given a room at high floor ( as requested upon booking) Elderly might find the walk to train station tedious, but you can utilise the free shuttle bus service to Seoul station to access to your destinations.

Show more
Regina , Singapore
The Shilla Seoul
8.9 Excellent
Based on 719 reviews

Believe the hype, the Shilla hotel is simply one of the very best, if not THE best hotel in Korea. From the lavishly decorated surroundings, to the large, beautiful lobby, to the many gourmet restaurants, top-notch facilities, expertly-trained staff, and outstanding guest rooms, what more can you want in a 5-star luxury hotel? Even the most basic guest room is large, modern, and meticulously clean.

The bedding, in particular, is the most luxurious and comfortable I've ever experienced....better than in most 5-star hotels I've stayed at inculding the best in the US and Europe. The staff are expertly trained, fluent in multiple languages, and very attentive. The facilities, esp. the outdoor pool, fitness center, and spa are amazing. I would also highly recommend the dinner buffet at the Parkview restuarant....expensive but not to be missed! The location is good in that it's up on a hill, away from traffic noise, but a little bad in that a quick access to surrounding neighborhood is a bit difficult.

Show more
Peter , United States
Crown Park Hotel Myeongdong Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 735 reviews

I almost missed my flight because of the hotel staff aren't organized I have booked a taxi to the airport one day in advance,however the taxi was late for 25 minutes.

i actually intended to take a taxi from the street but the staff keeps lying ( Sir 5 m and the taxi will be here ) Also,breakfast was awful ,there was just a little choices. And if you don't like Asian food then you are in big trouble.i stayed for 10 nights breakfast was included but I went there ones.moreover breakfast starting from 6:30 tell 9:30 very early start in Korea because shops opens around 10:30 The hotel building is new,however room service is under average.and the is a bad smell if you open the window or if you go outside the hotel Also there is no dinning in service and the restaurant close around 9:30pm

Show more
Omar , Saudi Arabia
Amanti Hotel Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 574 reviews

The hotel is clean and stylish but not close to the metro station as expected. It is suggested using exit 1 of the Hodgkin university station to the hotel rather than exit 9.

The staff spoke good English and were very responsive. Their excellent attitude were the best part of the hotel. However, the room design and the hotel policy were weird. There was no shower curtain in the bathtub and you had to shower very cautiously to avoid the whole floor getting wet. The light motion sensor was too sensitive that made the lights turning on and off frequently. The most absurd part was that the air-conditioning of the whole hotel was off during this period. When we found the room was stuffy, we were told by the staff that it was the hotel policy that there won't be air conditioning for rooms until 26 April 2017. On our request, the hotel managed to change a room with individual control of air con to us. There was no lock for the bathroom door and tea bags only provided on the first day.

Show more
KIT , Hong Kong
Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1114 reviews

If you’ve decided to stay in Myeongdong, Solaria is right smack in the middle of the action. And it’s just 3, 4 minutes' walk to Myeongdong subway and the airport limousine bus stop.

Top-notice quality and comfort. Plus everything is still new and clean as the hotel is only a little over a year old. The room hallway is longish, so the bed area becomes a bit small. We had to move the chairs around to fit our two large suitcases. But overall still a rather decent size. Loved that there was a small window we could open for fresh air. Our room was on the ninth floor facing the shopping street, but we never heard a thing. The bed and pillows were fine, the quilt was super comfortable. Separate toilet with a mini wash basin. The bathroom was roomy and had both a bathtub and a shower. Tea and coffee, pyjamas (sort of a long cotton shirt), toiletries, hairdryer, slippers all provided. Staff were helpful and efficient and excellent English spoken. Definitely recommended.

Show more
Janet , Singapore
L7 Myeongdong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 700 reviews

Location is perfect, easy access to different places and close to airport bus stop. Overall, the hotel is good during the stay, but I think the housekeeping staff should remember to do vaccum cleaning during the guest's stay! Moreover, I have been waiting for more the half and hour for the check-in, and there is no signage where I should stand up and wait, and there is one management coming out from the BOH and she saw me waited for long, she just passed by slowly and even didn't assist the counter or asked what could she do for the guests (the counter staffs has difficulty to communicate with the guests at the counter) or asked the guests to wait (for waiting check-in guests), which the counter was busy at the time, which I think a hotel management shouldn't behave like this?

Mei , Macau
Oakwood Premier Coex Center
8.7 Excellent
Based on 571 reviews

Being from U.S., and needing a king size bed to accommodate myself, my wife, and a 13 month old, Oakwood presented itself as one of the more reasonably priced 4-5star hotels.

I never heard anything of the hotel. But once we got there, I was definitely impressed. The room we booked was more an apartment than a hotel room. Complete with kitchen, living room, bedroom, and even a washer/dryer laundry machine. The location was perfect. Located right on top of the Coex mall, you can take the elevator down right to the mall, or the casino next door. The subway was also not that far off and can be walked to without stepping outside. Next door is the Air City terminal where you can actually check in your luggage for your departure flight then just hop a bus straight to the airport. I also stayed at the Intercontinental next door, but actually preferred the Oakwood, due to its bigger room size and more centered location within the Coex. The only downside I would say is the one dining experience I had there (breakfast buffet) was not all that compared to the breakfast buffets at some of the other 5star hotels. Also, the other 5 star hotel staff definitely spoke better English. Don't get me wrong, Oakwood staff was very accommodating and friendly, and this would not stop me from choosing them again. All in all, this place is a hidden gem. Definitely would recommend it to friends traveling to Seoul.

Show more
John , United States
G2 Hotel Myeongdong
8.9 Excellent
Based on 189 reviews

※Upon check in to the room, we notice there are two different electrical outlet 110V and 220V, however the 110V and USB outlet wasn't working at all, so we had to wait for the maintanence guy to come in to get it fix for us and in the end they were able to get the 110V to work, but not the USB outlet.

※Booked the "Deluxe Room" but feel like we were given the "Standard room" as the room feels quite small. ※Initially thought the shower and bath tub would be seperate. but turns out it was together. It was honestly quite hard to shower in a small bath tub. I feel like I was going to fall over many times, and I am not even that big.. ※Our room (despite the hotel being newly open few month ago) had a water leak situation from upstairs and the dripping is terribly loud which surprise me because the hotel is new and this is definately not something we were expecting from a new hotel. ※On the second night, arrived back at the hotel around 10PM and ask if we could get food deliver to the hotel, but choice are limited to Pizza and Fried chicken ONLY. Which was depressing consider Korea is famous for "home delivery restaurant that operate 24 hours or until 2-3am at least". However as we don't have the ability to speak Korean, we could only ask for help from front desk. and the person in charge doesn't seem to want to help us with ordering from other restaurants. we didnt end up ordering anything. ※Not much restaurant available around the hotel after 9PM. (we tried one near the hotel that opens 24 hour but the taste we can't recommend) Other closest restaurant is 10 minute away to MyeongDong main street areas which is slightly far. Overall, if a hotel doesn't provide convenience and comfort it is not a good hotel, speaking from our three days stay, my parnter and I dont think we will be staying with the hotel again.

Show more
MAGGIE , Taiwan
Tmark Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 720 reviews

We just had a pleasant stay at TMark Myeongdong. We booked a Family Twin for our family with 2 young kids.

The room is well kept and clean, though it is a bit cramped for 1 king and 1 single bed. We were able to check in before 11 am and check out late. Since we were taking an Airport Limo Shuttle Bus, we need to walk about 5 min from the bus stop through a small road to reach the hotel. The hotel is strategically located. Not in the main road, but subway is within 5 min walk and Myeongdong Shopping District is within 15 min walk. Convenience stores, coffee shops and restaurants are plenty around the hotel. Just in front of the hotel, there are many restaurants. Our favorite is the local restaurant with orange sign that sells many variety of foods from gimbap, ramen, udon, cutlets, etc. Thank you, TMark Hotel!

Show more
Amelia , Indonesia
Pacific Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1018 reviews

Its a pretty good hotel and we got a free upgrade to a better room with spacious space. However hotel seems a little dated but the hotel staff has kept up good work to maintain its cleanliness.

Do note that the gym is only for males as it is combined with the sauna. The gym is basically equipped with bench presses and free weights up to 15kg dumbbells. For those who are heading to the airport, I would suggest to take the free shuttle from hotel to Seoul Station at 10am, 1230pm, 2pm, 3.30pm an 4.30pm (Weekdays) and 9.30am, 10.50am, 1pm, 4.20pm, 3.40pm and 7pm (Weekend). The journey is about 10 mins or less depending on traffic. Then head straight to AREX departure hall (Level B2) for the express train to the airport. The one-way AREX train ticket is 8,000KRW and the express train takes 43 min from Seoul to Incheon (every 30 min), 10 min walk to airport check-in counter at Incheon Airport). The airport limousine bus stop for 6701 (16,000KRW one way) is quite closed to the hotel, yet a distance for us to walk, especially with heavy luggages. The estimated travel journey is around 90 min, depending on traffic condition and also how full is the each limousine bus. If the bus load is full, you have to wait for another 20 to 25 min.

It only take 5 minutes walk to the metro station. After crossing the metro station, the center of 弘大 will be in front of you, so the location is very good. Hotel appearence: the hotel is new, it is clean and tidy. there is a public resting area suited with computers with free internet service. It also provide maps and leaflets. The hotel provide food for breakfast but you need to cook yourself and then clean the dishes. It is a very basic breakfast with toast, cereal, ham and egg, coffee and orange juice. It is a 3-storey building without lift, but the staffs with help you with the luggages. Room: The room is also clean and tidy which use an electronic digital lock at the door which is quite secure. Our double room suited with a tiny kitchen so that you can cook for breakfast or night snack. They provide room service everyday which surprised me a lot. As we all know that guesthouse or hostel only provide room service upon request, so my room was cleaned everyday when i came back. But one thing need to improve is that there is no serparate between the toilet area and bathing area, so all the toilet became wet after taking shower. Staff: It is the soul of this place. All the staffs are youngsters who can speak fluent english which is even better than most of the Honkongers. They are all very helpful and friendly and they treat you like a friend rather than a customer. Overall: the price here might be a bit higher when comparing with other hostel or guesthouse, but it worth it. If you really choose to stay here, treat here like a friend's home rather than just a hotel with a room for sleep. You can earn a much better experience.

We were a group of 4 girls when we stayed during our 9-day trip in Seoul. Location: Finding the place from Myeongdong station was not a problem since the manager gave us a detailed instruction.

Value for money/Facilities Our room is well-equipped with the basics that we need for our stay. The free breakfast was also a pleasant surprise for us. The common kitchen in the 4th floor also has a good view to go with thebreakfast There is also a small honesty store in case you need snack and doesn't want to go out. Some things are self-service like getting clean towels and tissues and placing your trash in the specified area but it doesn't cause you any inconvenience, in fact, it is more convenient for us. Staff Yeji, the manager, responds to emails and easy to communicate with. We didn't have much time to talk and meet up during our stay but when we did, she's always warm and helpful. It was a nice stay. Plenty of restaurants around the hotel, right near the subway, staff was fluent in English, and the lounge had a nice make-it-yourself breakfast and had internet access.

Also, the room was clean. My criticisms would be that there was no English station on the TV in the room, the sink was a little bit broken at the bottom, so water leaked out onto the floor when using it, and the bathroom was tiny. Also, and this is a criticism for many hotels I've stayed in around the world(but not too much in the States), the bathroom floor becomes very slippery when wet and there's soft soap on it. It's very easy to slip in the bathroom. Either bathroom floor stickers or a no-slip finish should be in the bathroom, if you don't want accidents to happen. The stickers are very easy to find and apply. Unfortunately most hotels and hostels don't do it until they learn the hard way and have someone slip and have a bad accident.

It was a fairly good stay & I'd consider going back to this guesthouse if I can't find another one that meets my requirements the next time I visit Seoul.

It was my second time visiting Seoul, this time with just a friend. It was just the 2 of us so we took a bunkbed room. The room size was expected but with the price we paid, we thought it was quite nice considering the facilities they provide i.e. hot flask & 2 cups, hair dryer, etc. We stayed for 7 nights and kept the room quite clean ourselves so we didn't request for room cleaning. Only problem we had was the shower heater wasn't consistent & after the 2nd night, the water didn't subside as quickly as it did on the 1st day. The bathroom would get flooded in less than 5 minutes & water would get into the room. Location wise, it was super convenient. Less than 10mins walk to City Hall station or Hoehyeon Station. Namdaemun underground market was just right outside & there's so many shops selling kpop albums & unofficial merchandise. Many restaurants & cafes down the road on either directions, convenient store just right downstairs around the corner. We stayed on the 5th floor. Construction was still ongoing but it wasn't really a problem for us(1 of us is a heavy sleeper, 1 a light sleeper). Heads up, the bathroom is really quite small. Only thing I was curious about was the men standing outside those pubs down the small alley along the entrance of the guesthouse. Most of them had an earphone on one side & they seem to be carrying a walkie talkies or something like that. We see them outside every night. But they don't really bother you or do anything, so don't worry about that. They just hang around outside. I'm still curious what they're supposed to do there. In conclusion I'm quite satisfied with my stay this time round as well, though I was so glad to be home to use a slightly bigger bathroom, sleep on a comfier bed, and step on dust-free floor....

Alyson , Malaysia
24 Guesthouse Namsan Garden
8.7 Excellent
Based on 389 reviews

The guesthouse is only a few mins walk away from the Ginpo/ Incheon airport bus/shuttle bus stops and the MRT station.

This is very convenient for those travelling with luggages since they need not transfer from one bus to another. The station is also very near the Myeong dong shopping district, and has close proximity to convenience stores, Korean bbq restaurants, coffee shops, fastfood chains and the Lotte department stores. We visited Seoul during the grand Korea Sale so the location coulnd't have been more perfect. It is also around 10-15 minutes walk away from the cable car station going to N Seoul Tower. The staff was very friendly and helpful, offering assistance on tours and city directions. The staff can also speak English fluently, which might probably explain why a lot of foreigners were there alsk when we visited (most of them are returning customer). The guesthouse also offer hearty and yummy self-service breakfast from 8 am to 11 am. The floors and the rooms are well heated during winter and are very clean--- the standard double room comes with TV, ref, and free wifi. You just have to request for bath towels since what they have are a number of small towels in the room. Body wash, shampoo and conditioners are also available for free, with heated showers. Not all rooms though have bathrooms all to themselves, you just have to check the room types. However, shared bathrooms/shower rooms are clean as there are cleaninng staff who come in regularly. The guesthouse is also situated in a quiet and secure location- just be prepared to walk a little bit uphill from the main road. They also have a cute homey backyard where you can eat and do barbecue (too bad for us, we can't do so because it was freezing when we visited). We recommend this guesthouse for couples, solo backpackers, and even for small families with kids. We will definitely come back to this guesthouse on our next visit to Seoul.

8.1 Excellent
Based on 471 reviews

Ladies and gentlemen, this is Namsan Guesthouse #4. From Myeongdong metro, as you walk towards Guesthosue #4, you will pass by #3, followed by #2, which are well-labelled.

However, #4 is not! Guesthouse #4 is the building immediately after #2, so just bear this in mind. The dorms were very clean and were like the Japanese pod hotels (except a lot cheaper than those). There was full privacy: you have curtains, your personal TV, reading light and power plug for charging electronic devices. Lockers also provided, which should fit two backpacks easily. The shared bathroom was relatively clean as well. Shampoo and body foam were provided, as was the towel which you get upon checking in. In the common area, all-day breakfast is yours to consume. There is ramen cup noodles (which makes for a good supper), and also toast and peanut butter and jelly. Water dispensers (hot/cold) also available. The location is fantastic as well, just across the road from the arterial Myeongdong shopping area. Metro is about 5 min walk away. And going uphill from the guesthouse brings you to the Namsan Park cable car where you can go up to visit N Seoul Tower. Absolutely value-for-money, and worth the stay if you are coming to Seoul.

This is our first trip to Korea and Seoul. Well before our arrival, the Town Guesthouse host, Jay, contacted us and gave us clear directions in English(!) to the Guesthouse, our room number and password.

That was very nice.. On our second morning there (Wed 6th Apr 2016), we realised that we had left our tablet pc in a hotel in Busan when we left the morning before. We immediately contacted Jay and requested his help to call the hotel in Busan as we do not speak Korean and was afraid that the hotel staff in Busan may not understand us well. Initially, Jay could not get through the line, but he persisted and tried many times, and finally managed to get through to the hotel in the afternoon. When we returned to the Guesthouse in the evening, he had good news for us -- the Busan hotel found our tablet pc and after Jay's call, had packed the tablet and sent it to him by courier! We were so happy! On Thurs morning, Jay had more good news -- the tablet pc has arrived! :) Wow! We were amazed at the helpfulness of Jay and the Busan hotel staff and the efficiency of the Korean system!!! With that good start, we had a very pleasant 5 nights stay in the Guesthouse in Seoul. The room we had was well furnished -- just like at home, although we did not use most of the appliances. Jay is a very friendly and good host; he responds quickly to any query that I had... The best part was that he's fairly conversant in English! :)

More about Seoul

Seoul is a city of enchanting history and economic success, a destination worthy of both the leisure and business traveler. International travelers are introduced to the city via the Seoul Incheon International Airport. Short term travelers have the option of modern airport hotels, but it is only a 30-minute ride into the city from here.

Those looking to experience the city’s culture have much going for them. The highlight here would be Changdeok-gung, a royal palace dating back to 1405 and a World Heritage Site. Between the grand sites are a collection of royal shrines, Buddhist temples, and museums. The DMZ, or de-militarized zone separating North and South Korea, makes for a worthy day-trip as well.

Shopping is undoubtedly available in abundance here. The areas around Insadong Street are some of the most famous in South Korea, offering gift shops, art galleries, and traditional tea shops. Myeong-dong offers up-market shopping amongst a collection of Western-styled hotels. In Gangnam, visitors will find the upscale dining and entertainment venues. This district also boasts the city’s latest shops and hotels.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Seoul for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

As this is a very new hotel, everything is new and modern. Room is equipped with L-shape sofa, writing table, safebox, small fridge, hair dryrer, usb port socket, bathrope, bathtub and commplete set of toiletries. Hotel is very close to Euljiro 3(sam)-ga subway station (green and orange line), about 5 mins walk. The airport limousine bus (no.6015) also stop at Euljiro 3(sam)-ga bus stop. Walking distance about 800 meters to popular Myeongdong street. We even walking back from N Seoul Tower to the hotel, the distance is about 2.5 km and since it is going downhill from N Seoul Tower, the walk is very easy. Hotel has a gym and lounge at level 18 which we can enjoy the free flow of coffee all day long. Each floor itself also has a 'refresh room' fitted with water dispenser machine, ice cube machine, microwave oven and ironing tools. This is very good as we can save the money on buying the drinking water or mineral water. However at the hotel lobby, there is a 24 hours convenient store (G25) where we bought our T-Money card. International travelers are introduced to the city via the Seoul Incheon International Airport . Short term travelers have the option of modern airport hotels, but it is only a 30-minute ride into the city from here. Those looking to experience the city’s culture have much going for them. The highlight here would be Changdeok-gung, a royal palace dating back to 1405 and a World Heritage Site. Between the grand sites are a collection of royal shrines, Buddhist temples, and museums. The DMZ, or de-militarized zone separating North and South Korea, makes for a worthy day-trip as well. Shopping is undoubtedly available in abundance here. The areas around Insadong Street are some of the most famous in South Korea, offering gift shops, art galleries, and traditional tea shops. Myeong-dong offers up-market shopping amongst a collection of Western-styled hotels. In Gangnam, visitors will find the upscale dining and entertainment venues. This district also boasts the city’s latest shops and hotels. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Seoul for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
